item.title: Favorite music track in the context of the game
item.dc:creator: Sentinelrv
item.description:
Two areas I thought needed some action music were when you get to the first tank where there are multiple manholes that you can come out of. The other area was where the osprey was lowering soldiers and you had to load the missile launcher to blow up the tank.

Just to try it out, in the background I loaded up Hard Technology Rock and Diabolical Adrenaline Guitar from the original game in these areas and it was awesome! It made the game seem even more like Half-Life.

item.title: Favorite music track in the context of the game
item.dc:creator: Giazzo
item.description:
“Inbound”. Probably due to its psychological connection to the moment of excitement of finally be able to run BM for the very first time.
Also it’s very creepy… somehow preannounces that it won’t be an “ordinary day” for the poor chap. :retard:

I also liked the old “On A Rail” track. The sound reminded me of the music of Deus Ex and UT99, especially when the synth kicks in.

[Note: I’m playing very slowly in these days, just finished Surface Tension, so from what I’m reading the best is yet to come…]

item.title: Favorite music track in the context of the game
item.dc:creator: LifeSuks
item.description:
I know this is shitty to say, and I’ll probably try posting something constructive on it later, but I literally could not stand 80 to 90 percent of the new music. Everytime a song played I found myself wondering what the hell they were thinking. Anyway, sorry, I apologize, and I will post some constructive comments on the soundtrack later, but, as it stands, I just want desperately to put the original music back in

Nevertheless,
The track that plays as you enter the giant conveyor room from residue processing was phenomenal. It was so good I replayed the two or so minutes section five or six times.

The ambient track the plays in the grunt-pod room at the beginning of questionable ethics was flawlessly executed as well.

But…other than that…

item.title: Favorite music track in the context of the game
item.dc:creator: Paz_Ortega_Andrade
item.description:
I love all the music in this game, but here are some of my favorites:

  1. The introduction song that plays while riding the train. Inbound sequence. Feels great.
  2. The ambient song that plays in Unforeseen Consequences.
  3. Music that plays while the giant monster with three tentacles is being burned.
  4. The ambush theme in Questionable Ethics.
  5. The train ride theme in “On a Rail” sequence.

And, of course, the Black Mesa main theme

I still have to complete the game though, so I’ll listen to more themes as I progress further.

item.title: Favorite music track in the context of the game
item.dc:creator: raiseer
item.description:
Like bloodshot, my favourite music track in the context of the game was definitely “Questionable Ethics 1”. SO awesome, when that great song began and the marines started raining down on me. LOVED the hell out of it. I died the first three times (or so) playing that part, but the music made up for it. So it was a total win/win situation: Either I succeed, or I get to listen to that song again.
Other favourite songs: Blast Pit 3, Surface Tension 3, Forget about Freeman, End Credits and, of course, the Black Mesa theme. So awesome. I continuesly listen to it for two days now, so in the end, I just bought the soundtrack.

item.title: Favorite music track in the context of the game
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
In order of my favorites

Questionable Ethics 1. That song with the part that played was amazing.

The tank battle in Forget about Freeman with that song playing, then the Surface Tension Cliff

theme, really cool after stepping out of that pipe, followed by the “trailer” theme at the gargantua chase, and finally the We’ve got Hostiles

part where you rise up to the surface and fight the HECU with mortars bearing down.

Honorable mention: the suit retrieval theme was pretty cool, especially because I never liked the original suit theme in HL1 that much.

The cut On a Rail track from the old gameplay, It doesn’t count here since I had to manually put it in though
